project00.title: Temperature Converter
project00.description: An application that allows users to convert Fahrenheit to Celsius or Celsius to Fahrenheit.

project01.title: Pinterest
project01.description: A Pinterest-style application allowing users to create boards and pins for whatever they like.
project01.technologiesUsed: Axios, Bootstrap, CSS3, ESLint, Firebase, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, jQuery, SCSS, Webpack

project02.title: Le Baguette
project02.description: A team-built website utilizing Firebase, Axios, and google authentication that allows users to create, display, update, and delete (CRUD) data from Firebase that immediately reflects on the loaded page. As a part of this group, I contributed the staff page, the filter function on the staff page, and the layout of the homepage.
project02.technologiesUsed: Axios, Bootstrap, CSS3, ESLint, Firebase, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, jQuery, Moment.js, SCSS, Webpack

project03.title: Jurassic World
project03.description: The second of our team websites, this project also utilized Firebase, Axios, and google authentication we took over from a different group so we performed code refactoring and code cleanup. Additionally, I contributed to retrieving staff data and assigning them to rides as well as creating the modal allowing for that selection.
project03.technologiesUsed: Axios, Bootstrap, CSS3, ESLint, Firebase, Fontawesome, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, jQuery, Moment.js, Node-cron, SCSS, Webpack

project04.title: Capstone: writersResort
project04.description: writersResort allows users to post poems and invite feedback on those poems. Each user has access to edit and delete their own posts, via Axios calls, as well as any comments they've created. Each deleted post also deletes any comments associated with the post. Authentication occurs through Google and also pulls user's displayURL and Google Username.
project04.technologiesUsed: Axios, Bootstrap, CSS3, ESLint, Firebase, Fontawesome-svg-core, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, Moment.js, Prop-Types, ReactDOM, ReactJS, React Flip Move, React-fontawesome, React Router DOM, Reactstrap, SCSS

project05.title: React Movie Database
project05.description: This application pulls from the OMDB API and allows users to search for movies by title. If an incoherent or incorrect text string is placed in the search box, an alert appears asking for a new string. Results are limited to the top 10 results from the database.
project05.technologiesUsed: Axios, CSS3, ESLint, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, ReactDOM, ReactJS, React Hooks

project06.title: CoVID-19 Tracker
project06.description: This app tracks the number of confirmed cases, the number of recovered cases, and the number of deaths for CoVID-19 data from a global and country (181 countries) perspective. All data pulled from this API and last date/time of information gathered displayed in cards at top of the page.
project06.technologiesUsed: Axios, Chart.js, Classnames, CSS3, ESLint, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, Material-UI, Moment.js, ReactDOM, ReactJS, React-ChartJS-2, React CountUp, React Hooks

project07.title: React Weather App
project07.description: This application utilizes the openweathermap API and allows users to search for current weather based on city name. For good measure, since the API doesn't specify the state the city is in, latitude and longitude are also listed to be more specific. The background changes based on the temperature: at or below 60°F renders a cooler colored background; at or above 61°F renders a warmer colored background.
project07.technologiesUsed: CSS3, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, ReactDOM, ReactJS, React Hooks

project08.title: React Face Detect
project08.description: This application utilizes the Clarifai API to detect a face within a photo and then frame that photo in a white box. Version 1 is limited to 1 face detected per photo.
project08.technologiesUsed: Clarifai, CSS3, ESLint, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, ReactDOM, ReactJS, Tachyons

project09.title: Breaking Bad Cast
project09.description: This application pulls from the Breaking Bad API and displays 63 character images from the TV show "Breaking Bad". Hovering over any of the the images reveals a character's actor's name, nickname, date of birth, and status (alive or dead). Additionally, the search box at the top of the screen allows users to filter the results by character name.
project09.technologiesUsed: Axios, CSS3, ESLint, HTML5, JavaScript/ES6, ReactDOM, ReactJS, React Hooks
